wikipedia_page.main: James Barber  (16 July 1940 — 5 January 2020) was a British senior research investigator and emeritus Ernst Chain professor of biochemistry at Imperial College London, Visiting Professor at the Polytechnic University of Turin and Visiting Canon Professor to Nanyang Technological University (NTU) in Singapore.

response: UEA alumni in the sciences include the 2001 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine laureate and former President of the Royal Society Sir Paul Nurse (PhD, 1973); the 2020 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine winning co-discoverer of Hepatitis C and of the Hepatitis D genome Sir Michael Houghton (Biological Sciences, 1972); vaccinologist Dame Sarah Gilbert (Biological Sciences, 1983) who designed the Oxford–AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine, Dame Emily Lawson (PhD, 1993) who leads the NHS COVID-19 vaccine programme, Darwin Medal, Darwin–Wallace Medal and Erwin Schrödinger Prize winning evolutionary biologist Nick Barton (PhD, 1979);‘BARTON, Prof. Nicholas Hamilton’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Potamkin Prize winning pathologist Karen Duff (Biological Sciences, 1987); climate scientists Tim Lenton, Chris Turney,University of East Anglia Alumni Directory Neil Adger, Benjamin D. Santer, Timothy Osborn, Keith Briffa, Sarah Raper, and Peter Thorne; and the Fellows of the Royal Society James Barber,‘BARBER, Prof. James’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Keith Beven, Mervyn Bibb,‘BIBB, Prof. Mervyn James’, Who's Who 2016, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2016 Lucy Carpenter, Richard Flavell,‘FLAVELL, Dr Richard Bailey’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Don Grierson,‘GRIERSON, Prof. Donald’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Brian Hemmings,‘HEMMINGS, Dr Brian Arthur’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Terence Rabbitts,RABBITTS, Prof. Terence Howard, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 and Nick Talbot.
* Prof James Barber, Ernst Chain Professor of Biochemistry since 1989 at Imperial College London
*James Barber (biochemist) (1940–2020), British professor of biochemistry at Imperial College London
*James Barber (rugby), New Zealand rugby footballer who represented New Zealand in rugby league
*James Barber FRS, Professor of Biochemistry at Imperial College London
